comments.body:
Birthday cake?

Add X torches for that extra touch..
Why not make it so it would also deal a heart of damage when a randomised slice is eaten because of the berry bush, instead of saturation?
396522441672 Why do you think the entire bush would also get added to the cake instead of just the berries!?
*jacksepticeye comes running out of the woods with religious intent*
I like this idea a lot, since my favourite vegetable is the sweet potatoe! =)
Sweet potato stew would be nice to
It would be better to have the actual indigo plant with it
Maybe the actual flower can be put in-game as well for even more decorations
I’ve wanted this color in Minecraft for a very long time. Full support, and I agree with GinetteDeParis’s additional suggestion (see the comment from March 28th) of adding an indigo plant/flower.
And we need a proper green too!
why obsidion tho, just diamond is enough. And obsidian is useful enough because of how hard it is to break.

Could you give an example for the types of drinks you'd like to be implemented?

Personally, I can't think of any drinks other than milk or water that would make sense in the minecraft world, other than perhaps some alcoholic beverages like beer, but I can't see that being added to minecraft.
I’m totally agree with he

how is mead (we already have the honey) and

that you can drink the water potion.

or beer using fermentation in a new working block with wheat

We definitely need a food and drink update.

they ability to ser down food on a plate and run an inn would be fantastic.

making tea coffee beer mead would be great.

using the barrel and pouring  a drink you can place in front of players.

also being able to sit in a chair in front of the fire with a warm drink that counteracts the frosty snowy weather.
That is a super cool idea! but maybe the 80% chance is a little to much, maybe the more rocks the higher the chance.
Yes, rocks on the ground should be collected for a bottom-tier line of stone tools
I like the idea of rocks/stones on the ground from 1-4. But idk about the tripping factor, what if some of us want to use it as decoration?
Maybe rocks could be entities, making them pushable and have the ability to fall and bounce. It could also be a source of Cobblestone by combining 9 of them.
BS, I can easily remake the Minecon 2011 cape using a Black Banner with Orange Creeper Charge and Red Base Gradient

Adding this to Java would be great along with having enchanted books have their enchantments apply to them.

Who wouldn't want to beat up a zombie with a sharpness 5 book or a fire aspect pufferfish? Sure, you could accidentally eat your battle salmon while blocking but that's a risk I'm willing to take...

I think this is a great idea as well. It would allow me to create better looking, and more creative magic items, such as a staff of fire using a fire aspect blaze rod. Or a staff of lightning using an end rod with channeling.

I do dearly miss the god apples. The apple now feels more like a trophy then an actual consumable. Considering the effects where also servery nerfed, I don't see why it was made uncraftable.

I do get the appeal of finding legendary items but since the player never really sets out with the intent of finding a god apple (usually), the experience is more of a "Oh, cool." instead of a "Yes! Finally!".

If Mojang wants to keep the god apple as a collection item, it might be worth giving the player some hints on its location.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.
Agreed. I'm also open to them buffing the Enchanted Golden Apple's Regeneration status effect - it's terribly weak at the moment.
It was useful to casual players but overpowered to hardcore players so they took it out. One of those decisions that probably didn't make sense to a lot of people. Still doesn't to me.
Why was this feature taken away I miss being able to craft enchanted apples.

Seems fair.
If I had to guess the cooldown might be there to stop people enderpearling from the end island to the outer islands. But I'm not sure.
I like the idea but i think it would be a good idea to have it as a gamerule
yep as a gamerule
/gamerule doenderpearlcooldown true/false
IMO, the cooldown doesn't really add anything to the game experience. It just makes it less fun.
I don't think that will fit the feel of minecraft. I believe vaccines should me a mod more than the vanilla minecraft.

I would rather have the player make a vaccine that prevents villagers from becoming zombies. Vaccinating could unlock a special deal that curing from zombification does not. It would be cool if in each world the ingredients for a successful vaccine were randomly selected from a list of items. In this way the player would have to test different vaccine recipes to find the one that works in that world. The player could test on cows to see if it works. (This would require the introduction of zombie cows).

But why would I want to take off my armor? I think it would be cool if your put a beacon in the middle of a crafting table and put 1 string on top of the beacon and surround it in emerald blocks. It would work like a beacon but it would take the effects a beacon would give you were ever you go but will not have a good durability but you could turn it on or off by putting it in your off hand!

What if you were not in combat and you wanted to take your armor off when you don't need it? I just think that would be cool. Thank you for replying to my post. I know you don't understand why Anyone would want to take their armor off but I just think it would be a fun tool. Please get your family/friends to vote for this post!
I'm allergic to nuts, that would suck.
Not very nessasary, but it would be pretty cool having vine nuts. :)

Hmm, this item would be more for multiplayer, but if you play alone, what use would it bring? It would not work as an ender chest nor as a beacon, so its use would be inefficient in singleplayer, now who knows if it will have a use beyond what I think but hey, let's say it is useful for multiplayer, it would have the same catalyst items to send items to another player, right? I would suggest that the type of mineral is proportional to the number of items to be sent and the time it would take to send those items, that is:

  • Iron could only send 32 items being stackable or no item not stacking (INS) within 2 days of Minecraft (DMC)
  • Copper: 2 stacks or only 2 INS at 1.8 DMC
  • Gold: 4 stacks or 6 INS at 1.4 DMC
  • Diamond: 8 stacks or 12 INS at 1 DMC
  • Emerald: 14 stacks or 20 INS at 0.7 DMC
  • Netherite: 20 stacks or 27 INS at 0.2 DMC
I think the idea of this new type of cave is to force players to explore the underground, the same way spawners do, and build around it.
if you think this is a good idea please vote so that it will be in the game I think haveing more of a reason to fight mobs will be great and make players have more fun fighting mobs.

Foreign Language –  

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: “Infernal Tree”  

 

Text: “Trees growing in basalt delta biomes, the bark would be insulating, so the sticky blocks (pistons, honey, slime) would stick only on the barkless faces and the redstone would be transmitted only through exposed faces. For the appearance I imagine a bark similar to black gold and a similair trunk with smooth basalt but with veins of lava that would make that one could feed ovens with this wood
” 

- Translated by Admin
What would an emerald ray be? But no don't add tools/amour it give emeralds some uniqueness
Not every single ore has to be able to be crafted into tools, weapons and armor. And emerald apples wouldn't make sense.
It dosn't have to be all these things plus emerald ray can shoot a beam at your enemy

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: “ Silver bars and ores”

Text: “The silver ore would be used to make silver bars and consequently armor and silver tools. Silver items would be stronger and more resistant than iron items and weaker than gold items but more resistant. Silver ores would be as rare to be found as pencil-lasuli.”

- Translated by Admin
this has to go on minecon! Now, I can make skeletons stop shooting every dang second! Plus, you can use it to make your pet axolotls or dog or cat to move out of danger!
A even better idea is to make it actually hypnotize other players and make them follow you while holding the watch!

I beg to differ with your point of view.

I don't think it will become as powerful as you may think in early game as it can only hold one stack of items. This is just a balanced way for us to group together two types of items that could logically fit in one slot  together.16 stack items will count as 4 instead of 1 items, Unstackables won't be able to be stored. What you propose takes away the only feature bundles have, making them useless.

The crafting recipe for the bundle is unknown, we don't really know if this is an item that can be accessed in early or mid game as its crafting cost and its position in the tec-tree is unknown, it could also be uncrafteable and actually be a rare mob drop or chest loot. 

And to finish, a bundle and a shulker box are way more different than what you may expect them to be at first glance. Here's some differences:

-Shulkers have 27 "shareless" inventory slots, Bundles have only one shareable slot.
-Shulker are an endgame item, they can't be accessed in the main gameplay experience. Bundles, judging by their features & appearance, are obtainable during the main gameplay experience.
-With shulkers you decide what items to save inside and which to take from inside. Bundles unfill completely.

I don’t think it I’ll be overpowered at all since it seems it still limits the item count to the item type stack limit (usually 64). This almost makes it underpowered in my opinion. I would love to see an implementation where you do not have to take items out of bundles sequentially because if you can’t “open” the bundle into your inventory without free space, it makes bundles quite hard to use in practice. It also seems important that there is a way to drain the items out of bundles somehow like we can do from shulker using hoppers.
Quando e sce la 1.17
Also would need a new quartz/copper/stone head block
Big brain playz
I think it would be great if they added a 'displaced' version of the source blocks that looks the same, but doesn't actually spawn the crystals themselves, so that it can be used in decoration.
Can be like leaves: naturally generated amethyst blocks spawn crystals, but those placed by a player don't.
You can pick up the Amethyst crystals, and the blocks they spawn on but when you replace the blocks they don't grow the crystals back.
